com.google.gwt.user.client.dnd
Class WidgetListener

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.dnd.WidgetListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
SourcesDragEvents, com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.SourcesMouseEvents
public class WidgetListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.SourcesMouseEvents, SourcesDragEvents, com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener

Control class which allows to add a mouse, drag or drop listeners to all Widgets. If you're using a non SourcesMouseEvents Widget, calls this class only after adding your widget to a Panel or RootPanel. To drag and drop, simply call this constructor :

public class myProject() implements DragSourceListener { public void onModuleLoad() { Button myButton = new Button();
RootPanel.get().add(myButton, 10, 10);
WidgetListener myListener = new WidgetListener(myButton);
myListener.addDragListener(this);

} public void DragManager(DragSource myDrag) { } public void onDragDropEnd(DragSourceEvent event) { } .... }

If you want to use the addMouseListener and removeMouseListener methods, only use it on non SourcesMouseEvents Widgets.

Constructor Detail

WidgetListener

public WidgetListener(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget elem)
Constructor for WidgetListener.
Sets a sinkEvent to a widget, and apply a new one, and disable all default events.
If a widget is an instance of SourcesMousesEvent, it uses the default MouseListenerCollection class, else it uses the AdapterMouseListenerCollection class.

Parameters:
elem - the widget to apply a listener.
Method Detail

getWidgetListenerMap

public static java.util.HashMap getWidgetListenerMap()
Gets the widgetListenerMap.

Returns:
a hashmap containing a widget associated with this class.

public void addMouseListener(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.MouseListener listener)
Adds a MouseListener to a non SourcesMouseEvents Widget. Only use this method if your widget doesn't have his own addMouseListener method.
